topic.title: Open a Document in Oxygen from Another Application

body.note: This feature is currently only available for Mac OS X users.
body.p: The installation kit for Mac OS X comes with a special protocol handler that can be used if you want to open remote resources in the application (for example, opening a file from a CMS). The protocol is edit-in-oxygen and you can use it from a command line like this:open edit-in-oxygen:protocol://host/path/file.xml
For example, if you start the following from the command line:open edit-in-oxygen:http://www.oxygenxml.com/index.html
will start and open the HTML content from the URL http://www.oxygenxml.com/index.html.
body.note: You can also use anchors on the URL to point to specific lines or elements inside the open document: .
